docs.title: Welcome
docs.text:
Your Project Name is the easiest way to [solve a problem]. We built this to help [target audience] achieve [goal] without the hassle.

Replace this text with a simple, jargon-free description of your project.

docs.title: Features at a Glance
docs.text: Feature What it does for you Feature 1 Solves problem A instantly. Feature 2 Makes task B easier and faster. Feature 3 Keeps your data safe and secure. Feature 4 Allows you to work from anywhere.

docs.title: Quick Navigation
docs.text:
New UsersAdministratorsDevelopers
  1. Install: Follow the simple Installation Guide.
  2. Learn: Read the Usage Guide to get started.
  3. Explore: See all Features.
  1. Check: Verify System Requirements.
  2. Setup: Configure via Operations Guide.
  1. Code: Get the source code in Developer Installation.
  2. Understand: Read the Overview.

docs.title: Documentation Structure
docs.text:
• Release Notes --- See what's new in the latest update. Read Notes

  • Overview --- Learn what this project is all about. Read Overview

  • Features --- Discover everything this tool can do. See Features

  • Operations --- Manage and configure the system. Manage System

docs.title: Getting Started Flow
docs.text:
flowchart LR
    A[Download] --> B[Install]
    B --> C[Configure]
    C --> D[Enjoy!]
  1. Download the app for your computer.
  2. Install it following our simple guide.
  3. Configure your basic settings.
  4. Start using it!

Current Version: 2.x

You are viewing the latest version. Check Release Notes for changes.

docs.title: Need Help?
docs.text:
• Read Docs: Check the sidebar menu.
  • Report Bug: Let us know on GitHub Issues.
  • Ask Question: Chat in GitHub Discussions.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Goal: Explain what this project is and why it exists.

docs.title: What is Your Project Name?
docs.text:
Write a simple explanation here. Imagine explaining it to a friend.

Example: "This project helps you organize your photos automatically using AI, so you don't have to sort them manually."

Key Points to Cover: - What problem does it solve? - Who is it for? (Students, Businesses, Everyone?) - Why is it better than the alternatives?

docs.title: Key Concepts
docs.text: Explain important terms users might encounter.

docs.title: Concept 1: [Name]
docs.text: Simple explanation.

docs.title: Concept 2: [Name]
docs.text: Simple explanation.

docs.title: How it Works (Architecture)
docs.text:
Briefly explain how the system is built, but keep it simple.

flowchart LR
    User --> App
    App --> Database
    App --> Cloud
  1. User interacts with the App.
  2. App saves data to the Database.
  3. App syncs with Cloud for backup.

docs.title: Technology Stack
docs.text:
List the tools used to build this project.

Category Technology Frontend [e.g., React, Vue] Backend [e.g., Python, Node.js] Database [e.g., PostgreSQL]

Keep it Simple

Avoid using too much jargon. If you must use a technical term, explain it first!

docs.title: Features
docs.text: Goal: Showcase what your project can do.

docs.title: Core Features
docs.text: These are the main reasons people use your software.

docs.title: 1. [Feature Name]
docs.text:
What is it? Explain the feature simply.

Why use it? - Benefit 1 (e.g., "Saves you time") - Benefit 2 (e.g., "Keep your data safe") - Benefit 3 (e.g., "Easy to share")

Why use it? - Benefit A - Benefit B

Focus on Benefits

Don't just list what the feature is, explain how it helps the user.

docs.title: Installation Guide
docs.text: Goal: Help users get your application running on their computer.

docs.title: System Requirements
docs.text: Before installing, check if your computer meets these requirements:

docs.title: Hardware (Computer Specs)
docs.text: Component Minimum Recommended CPU Dual-core Quad-core RAM 4 GB 8 GB Storage 500 MB 1 GB

docs.title: Software (OS)
docs.text: Platform Requirement Windows Windows 10 or later Linux Ubuntu 20.04 or similar macOS macOS 10.15 or later

docs.title: User Installation
docs.text: Follow these steps to install the application.

docs.title: 1. Download
docs.text: Get the installer from our Releases Page. - Windows: YourProject-Setup.exe - Mac: YourProject.dmg - Linux: YourProject-linux.tar.gz

docs.title: 2. Install
docs.text:
WindowsmacOSLinux
  1. Right-click the downloaded file.
  2. Select Run as Administrator.
  3. Follow the instructions on the screen.
  1. Double-click the .dmg file.
  2. Drag the app icon into your Applications folder.
  3. Open it from Launchpad.
  1. Extract the file: tar -xzf YourProject-linux.tar.gz
  2. Open terminal in that folder.
  3. Run: ./install.sh

docs.title: Developer Installation
docs.text:
If you are a developer and want to modify the code:

  1. Get the Code: 

    git clone https://github.com/your-username/your-project.git
cd your-project

  2. Prepare Workspace: 

    # Create virtual environment
python -m venv venv

# Activate it
source venv/bin/activate  # Mac/Linux
venv\Scripts\activate     # Windows

  3. Install Libraries: 

    pip install -r requirements.txt

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text:
Common Issues:

  • Permission Denied? Try running as Administrator or using sudo.
  • Download failed? Check your internet connection.
  • Won't open? Make sure your OS is up to date.

docs.title: Operations Guide
docs.text: Goal: Detailed instructions for managing the system.

docs.title: Interface Overview
docs.text:
A quick tour of the screen.

Area What it does Top Bar Main navigation menus. Sidebar Quick access to different folders. Main View Where you do your work.

docs.title: General Settings
docs.text:
Go to Settings (Gear Icon).

  • Theme: Switch between Light and Dark mode.
  • Language: Change the app language.
  • Notifications: Turn alerts on or off.

docs.title: Advanced Settings
docs.text:
For advanced users only.

  • Database Path: Change where data is stored.
  • API Keys: Connect to third-party services.

docs.title: Keyboard Shortcuts
docs.text:
Save time with these shortcuts:

Action Shortcut New Ctrl + N Save Ctrl + S Find Ctrl + F Settings Ctrl + ,

docs.title: FAQ (Frequently Asked Questions)
docs.text:
Q: Where is my data saved? A: By default, it's in your Documents folder.

Q: Can I use this offline? A: Yes! You don't need internet for basic features.

Q: How do I update? A: Download the new version from our website and install it.

Need Help?

If you can't find the answer, contact support.

docs.title: Release Notes
docs.text: Goal: Tell users what changed in each update.

docs.title: v1.0 - The First Release
docs.text:
Released: [Date]

We are excited to launch Your Project Name! This is our first official version.

docs.title: Highlights
docs.text:
• Easy to use: Simple and clean interface.
  • Fast: Works quickly on all computers.
  • Secure: Your data stays private.

docs.title: New Features
docs.text:
• Feature A: Create documents easily.
  • Feature B: Export to PDF.

docs.title: Bug Fixes
docs.text:
• Fixed an issue where the app would close unexpectedly.
  • Fixed a typo in the menu.

docs.title: How to Upgrade
docs.text:
1. Download the new installer.
  2. Run it on your computer.
  3. It will automatically replace the old version.

docs.title: v0.9 (Beta)
docs.text:
• First public test version.
  • Basic features included.

Feedback

Found a bug? Let us know on GitHub Issues!

docs.title: Usage Guide
docs.text: Goal: Teach users how to use the application day-to-day.

docs.title: Step 1: Open the App
docs.text:
• Windows: Double-click the icon on your desktop.
  • Mac: Open from Applications.
  • Linux: Run from terminal.

docs.title: Step 2: First Setup
docs.text:
1. Create an Account (if needed).
  2. Adjust Settings like language or theme.
  3. Connect your data source.

docs.title: How to Create a New Item
docs.text:
1. Click the New button (+).
  2. Fill in the details.
  3. Click Save.

docs.title: How to Edit
docs.text:
1. Click on the item you want to change.
  2. Make your edits.
  3. Click Save.

docs.title: How to Export Data
docs.text:
1. Go to File > Export.
  2. Choose a format (PDF, Excel, etc.).
  3. Save it to your computer.

docs.title: Tips and Tricks
docs.text:
Did you know?

You can use keyboard shortcuts like Ctrl+S to save quickly!

Backup

Remember to export your data once in a while to keep it safe.

Need more technical details? Check the Operations Guide.

docs.title: Easy Guide: MkDocs + Mike
docs.text: This guide helps you understand how to manage different versions of your documentation (like v1.0, v2.0) using MkDocs and Mike.

docs.title: What is this?
docs.text:
• MkDocs: The tool that builds your documentation website from simple text files.
  • Mike: A helper that organizes your documentation into versions (e.g., "Old Version", "New Version").

Think of Mike as a librarian who organizes your books by edition.

docs.title: Simple Commands
docs.text:
Here are the only commands you really need to know:

Command What it does Use when... mkdocs serve Preview your site (only current version) You are writing and want to see changes instantly. mike serve Preview with version selector You want to test switching between versions. mike deploy Publish a version online You are ready to share your work.

docs.title: 1. First Time Setup
docs.text:
If this is your first time publishing version 1.0:

# Publish version 1.0 and call it "latest"
mike deploy --push 1.0 latest

# Tell the site to show "latest" by default
mike set-default --push latest

docs.title: 2. Updating Documentation
docs.text:
If you made changes and want to update the online site:

# Update the current version
mike deploy --push 1.0 latest

docs.title: 3. Releasing a New Version
docs.text:
When you are ready to release version 2.0:

# Publish version 2.0 and move "latest" to it
mike deploy --push --update-aliases 2.0 latest

Now users will see v2.0 as the main documentation, but v1.0 is still there if they need it!

docs.title: FAQ and Troubleshooting
docs.text:
Q: I see a "404 Error" when I open the site. A: You probably haven't set the default version. Run this: 

mike set-default --push latest

Q: I don't see the version dropdown. A: Check your mkdocs.yml file. It needs this section: 

extra:
  version:
    provider: mike

Q: How do I delete a mistake? A: You can delete a version like this: 

mike delete --push 1.0

You're all set!

Managing versions might sound complex, but it's just about publishing your changes to the right "bucket" (version).
